content:
Hey, @Wesley Wiser and I thought that it's time for another meeting. @simulacrum, you're probably interested in attending. Maybe @pnkfelix wants to listen in? Anybody else is also welcome of course. Our meetings happen here on zulip.

We were thinking of doing the meeting either this Thursday between 11:30 and 13:00 CEST or next Wednesday, about the same time frame (right, @Wesley Wiser?)
Either of those sound fine to me.
https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/meetingtime.html?iso=20190919&p1=37&p2=263
Yeah, that time frame and dates works for me.
OK, great. Let's see what @simulacrum says.
I think the agenda will be about establishing the current status and next steps.

I've seen a lot of interest recently in profiling what user code is causing the compiler to spend a lot of time. During the meeting, we should consider how that feature fits into our plans (https://github.com/rust-lang/measureme/issues/51).
ah yes, there's certainly interest in that
@mw if we could bump one hour to 12:30 then that seems fine, I probably can't make 11:30 as that's 5:30am here and I have midterms both this week and next
12:30 is no problem for me
Okay then I'm good for tomorrow 12:30-14:00 CEST, here?
er, thursday, I guess, actually
Doesn't look like I have access to compiler team calendar so I can't create the invite but maybe @pnkfelix or @mw do
let me try
is this meant to be a recurring meeting? Weekly? Monthly?
not currently no
accepted invite
thanks
I don't expect the meeting to be that long, btw :)
Ah. Well, we can always break early
